partners.text: This work was made by Datawheel founded by Antofagasta Minerals, Corporación de Fomento de la Producción, Ministerio de Economía, Fomento y Turismo and ENTEL. Also supported by: Dirección General de Relaciones Económicas Internacionales and Asociación de empremdedores de Chile.
partners.title: Participants

background.subtitle3: How do I get my data into DataChile?
background.text1: DataChile is a platform that integrates, visualises and distributes chilean public data. DataChile goal is improving efficacy and efficiency of public decision making, throughout integrated data that helps revealing gaps in public services, identifying industrial diversification opportunities, and fostering a better informed audience.
background.text2:
As of January 8, 2018, DataChile integrates information from 8 different public sources. These are:

  • Ministry of Social Development (MDS)
  • National Institute for Statistics (INE)
  • Chile’s Customs Office (ADUANAS)
  • Ministry of Economy (MINECON)
  • Ministry of Education (MINEDUC)
  • Educational Measurement, Registry, and Evaluation Department (DEMRE)
  • Immigration Department (MINISTERIO DEL INTERIOR)
  • Telecommunications Office (SUBTEL)
background.text3:
DataChile is not a big data project, or a universal data repository, but a system focused on integrated data sources that are relevant for public decision making. We are interested in data that is nationally comprehensive (available for most municipalities), relevant, and regularly updated.

If you would like your dataset to be considered for inclusion, please complete this form
background.title: Datachile

data.title: Datos
data.text: DataChile integrates 16 datasets from these sources: All of these can be exported as CSV files.

casen.title: Socio-Economic Characterization Survey (CASEN)
casen.text: Data created by the Ministry of Social Development (MDS). CASEN survey aims to deliver an "xrays examination" of socio-economic situation in Chilean households, being the principal data source to measure poverty and inequality, and it has been broadly used by international organizations and NGOs.
casen.use: This dataset is used in the nation,  region and comuna profiles in economy, household and health sections.

nene.title: New National Employment Survey (NENE)
nene.text: Data created by the National Institute for Statistics (INE). The New National Employment Survey (NENE) is realized on a monthly basis and classified the working age population (PET), all the people from 15 years old and more, by their occupational situation, by applying a set of worldwide accepted rules and defined by the International Labour Organization (ILO), from which is derived the approach to measure employment an unemployment and from households surveys.
nene.use: This dataset is used in the nation, region and comuna profiles in economy dimension.

nesi.title: New Income Supplementary Survey (NESI)
nesi.text: Data created by the National Institute for Statistics (INE). The New Income Supplementary Survey (NENE) is a complementary module for the NENE survey. It takes place on a yearly basis between October and December with the aim of characterising working incomes among occupied people in NENE survey and other sources of income, both at national and regional level.
nesi.use: This dataset is used in the nation, region and comuna profiles in economy section.

aduana.title: Exports and Imports Registry
aduana.text: Administrative registry created by Chile Customs that gives account of our import origins by country and our export destinations by comunas on monthly recordings.
aduana.use: This dataset is used in the nation, region and comuna profiles in the economy section, and in the country (destination), and product profiles.

iplusd.title: Expenditure and Employees in R+D Survey
iplusd.text: Data created by the Ministry of Economy (MINECON) and provided by the Internal Tax Service (SII). The aim of this survey is to gather information on financial and human resources dedicated to research and development activities in private companies.
iplusd.use: This dataset is used in the industry profile.

enrollment.title: Schools Enrollment
enrollment.text: Data created by the Ministry of Education (MINEDUC). Provides statistical information about students on the schooling system by level, grade and sex, and also geographical area, administration system and region of the school.
enrollment.use: This dataset is used on the nation, region and comuna profiles in the education section.

performance.title: Schools Performance
performance.text: Data created by the Ministry of Education (MINEDUC). Provides statistical information about how well schools perform on grade scores.
performance.use: This dataset is used on the nation, region and comuna profiles in the education section.

psu.title: Universities Admission Test (PSU)
psu.source: Educational Medition, Registry and Evaluation Department (DEMRE)
psu.text: Data delivered by the Ministry of Education (MINEDUC) and created by the Educational Medition, Registry and Evaluation Department (DEMRE) that contains information that provides PSU scores at school level, of schools by administration system (public or private), comunas and regions.
psu.use: This dataset is used on the nation, region and comuna profiles in the education section.

salud.title: Health Access Indicators
salud.text: Data published by the Health Statistics and Information Department (DEIS) with the aim of providing a general picture of the overall health situation in the country that gives information on the general medical, specialized medical and odontological attention.
salud.use: This dataset is used on the nation, region and comuna profiles in the health section.

muerte.title: Death Causes
muerte.text: Data published by the Health Statistics and Information Department (DEIS) with the aim of providing a general picture of the overall cause of mortality in the country considering World Health Organization (WHO) diseases and accidents classification.
muerte.use: This dataset is used on the nation, region and comuna profiles in the health section.

discapacidad.title: Disability National Survey (ENDISC)
discapacidad.text: Data created by the Disability National Service (SENADIS). This study allows us to know the situation of people with different types of disabilities in Chile and their relationship with respect to the general population, their environment, their daily activities and their social participation among other variables.
discapacidad.use: This dataset is used on the nation, region and comuna profiles in the health section.

vida.title: Life Expectancy
vida.text: Data created by the Health Statistics and Information Department (DEIS). This includes data on life expectancy at birth, which is an estimation of the average number of years that a group of people will be born in the same year, under constant mortality conditions in the evaluated country or region. This indicator allows us to do comparisons between countries across time.
vida.use: This dataset is used on the nation, region and comuna profiles in the health section.

poblacion.title: Population Projects
poblacion.text: Data created by the National Institute for Statistics (INE) based on 2002 Census that gives account for the general population at nation, region and comuna level and also health services that aggregate different comunas.
poblacion.use: This dataset is used on the nation, region and comuna profiles.

migracion.title: Migration Statistics
migracion.text: Data created by the Immigration Department: the organization in charge of giving residency permits to the alien population in the country. This registry considers the migrant population in normal situations. For example, in three years the same individual could have obtained three visas or two visas and and permanent residency. In that case, the registry will show the three visas or the two visas and the permanent residency without considering that those documents refer to the same person.
migracion.use: This dataset is used in the nation, region, and comuna profiles in the demography section.

internet.title: Internet Use Survey
internet.text: Survey distributed by the Telecommunications Office and created by IPSOS that attempts to show internet access and detailed reasons of why households are connected to the internet at national and regional levels.
internet.use: This dataset is used in the nation, region, and comuna profiles, in the housing section.

costes.title: Cost and Output Data
costes.text: Productivity data at the level of industry and comuna provided by the Tax Office (SII). This data tallies the number of workers, labour and capital cost, and output of each industry in a comuna.
costes.use: This dataset is used in the national, regional, and comuna profile, in the economy section, and in the industry profile.

servel.title: Electtion results and participation
servel.text: Public data available in Servicio Electoral (SERVEL). It shows the results from last elections: mayors, congress-people and president. The winners and also a detail of every candidate. Finally, we calculate the electoral participation at comuna level.
servel.use: This dataset is used in the nation, region, and comuna profiles.

felonies.title: Felonies of Greater Social Connotation
felonies.text: The statistics of the Felonies of Greater Social Connotation: These correspond to the groups denominated like 'Violent Crimes' (Robbery with Violence, Robbery with Intimidation, Robbery by Surprise, Injuries, Homicide and Violation), and 'Crimes against the Property' (Theft of Motorized Vehicle, Theft of Vehicle Accessories, Theft in Inhabited Place, Theft in Uninhabited Place, Other Robberies with Force and Theft).
felonies.use: This dataset is used in the nation, region, and comuna profiles.

ids.title: General Ids
ids.text: Metadata & ids for reference to other files.
ids.use: This dataset is used all over the site.

team.title: Team
team.text1: DataChile was created by Datawheel, a global leader in the creation of data integration, visualization, and distribution systems. Datawheel was founded by Cesar Hidalgo, Dave Landry and Alex Simoes in 2013. Datawheel is the creator of Data USA (winner of an Information is Beautiful Award in 2016 and a Webby Award in 2017), DataAfrica, DataViva, and other private systems for governments and firms.
team.text2: DataChile has received public and private financing. Initial support was given by Antofagasta Minerals early in 2016. At the end of 2016, Corfo and Chile’s Ministry of Economía joined the effort. Late in 2017, DataChile also received support from the Explora Lab of Entel.
team.text3: DataChile is a public good (owned by all Chileans), but it will be managed by the Chilean government starting April 2018, once Corfo funding finishes.
team.title4: Who is responsible for updating DataChile?
team.text4: Until April 2018 DataChile updates are the responsibility of Datawheel. Starting April 2018, DIRECON (Dirección General de Relaciones Económicas Internacionales), which is a department from the Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores, will take possession of DataChile and will be responsible for updating its data and features.
team.members:
Datachile's team is composed by:

  • Francisco Abarzúa
  • Manuel Aristarán
  • María Victoria Ferrieri
  • Catalina Gobantes Marín
  • César Hidalgo
  • Carlos Navarrete Lizama
  • Sebastián Melín
  • Pablo H. Paladino
  • Gabriela Pérez Ponce
  • Mauricio 'Pachá' Vargas

api.title: API
api.text1: DataChile has a data API, which delivers the info to build the charts and generate the texts site-wide.
api.title2: When will this API be available?
api.text2: The API will be released publicly on the occasion of Open Data Day, on March 3rd, 2018. We will also launch that day a map webapp to let users explore all available dimensions and variables.
api.title3: Meanwhile, how can I access the information DataChile distributes?
api.text3:
Next to each chart there's an option to download the information used to generate it. This raw information is available in CSV, XLS and JSON formats.

Likewise, in the Data Section you can access the files we used to populate our API, in CSV format.

terms.text: Information on this site is provided on an "as is" and "as available" basis. DataChile makes every effort to ensure, but does not guarantee, the accuracy or completeness of the information on the DataChile website. Our goal is to keep this information timely and accurate. If errors are brought to our attention, we will try to correct them. DataChile may add, change, improve, or update the information of the website without notice. DataChile reserves its exclusive right in its sole discretion to alter, limit or discontinue part of this site. Under no circumstances shall DataChile be liable for any loss, damage, liability or expense suffered which is claimed to result from use of this site, including without limitation, any fault, error, omission, interruption or delay. Use of this site is at User's sole risk. We make every effort to minimize disruption caused by technical errors. However some data or information on the DataChile website may have been created or structured in files or formats which are not error-free and we cannot guarantee that our service will not be interrupted or otherwise affected by such problems. DataChile accepts no responsibility with regards to such problems (failure of performance, computer virus, communication line failure, alteration of content, etc.) incurred as a result of using the DataChile website or any link to external sites. The User specifically acknowledges and agrees that DataChile is not liable for any conduct of any other User, including, but not limited to, the types of conduct listed above. DataChile reserves the right to deny at its sole discretion any User access to the DataChile website or any portion thereof without notice. For site security purpose and to ensure that the DataChile website remains available to all users, it employs software programs to monitor network traffic to identify unauthorised attempts to upload or change information, or otherwise cause damage and to detect other possible security breaches.
terms.title: Terms of Use

launch.title: 1.0.0 - Beta launch - 2018-01-08
launch.description: Main page. Profile explorer. Entity search. Profiles: geo, countries, industries, and products. More than 15 datasets about: economy, demography, education, health, and housing.

araucaria.title: 1.0.1 - "Araucaria" - 2018-01-19
araucaria.description: General bug fixes in various profiles, added background images, improved stability for Country Profile on countries with low data availability.

belloto.title: 1.1.0 - "Belloto" - 2018-01-26
belloto.description: New datasets: Allegations of main crime categories, available for Geo profile, Housing topic, Security section (Source: Carabineros de Chile). Fixes on Health Insurance IDs for the CASEN survey data on 2003 and 2006. Added Comuna of Ñiquén in selection map. Various fixes on texts and translations (nan, N/A, etc). Design and style adjustments for desktop and mobile. Fixes on download links to raw information sources on the About page. Improvement on query performance for homepage.

diamelo.title: 1.2.0 - "Diamelo" - 2018-02-09
diamelo.description: New dataset: Civic section. Electoral results and participation from last elections. Fixed some style issues. Added new download links to raw information sources on the About page.

encino.title: 1.2.1 - "Encino" - 2018-02-16
encino.description: New data visualizations in Civic section: electoral results: presidential, congress and mayor levels. Fixes in authorities in main splash.

migration_slide.destination: On {{year_last}}, Chile granted {{number_visas}} work, study or residence visas to immigrants coming from {{level}}. Most of these immigrants de estos arrived to {{region}}, mainly to the comuna of {{comuna}}.
migration_slide.growth: Between {{year_prev}} and {{year_last}}, the number of visas granted to immigrants coming from {{level}} has {{behavior}} at a annual rate of {{growth}}.
migration_slide.text_no: During {{year_last}}, there are no records of visas granted to immigrants coming from {{level}}.

migration_details_slide.sex_none: There are no records of immigrants from {{level}} on {{year_last}}.
migration_details_slide.sex_only: {{year_last}} is the only year there's an official record about immigrants from {{level}}. Most of the immigrants coming from {{level}} are {{current_max}}.
migration_details_slide.sex_changed: Most of the immigrants coming from {{level}} are {{current_max}}. This has been a tendency since {{year_prev}}, when most people were {{previous_max}}.
migration_details_slide.sex_remained: Most of the immigrants coming from {{level}} are {{current_max}}. This has been a tendency since {{year_prev}}.
migration_details_slide.age: Most of the immigrants coming from {{level}} are people ages {{first}}, followed by ages {{second}}. The former represent a {{first_percent}} of the total in {{year_last}}, which translates into a change of {{first_growth}} since {{year_prev}}.
migration_details_slide.age_double: Most of the immigrants coming from {{level}} are people ages {{first}}, followed by ages {{second}}. The former represent a {{first_percent}} of the total in {{year_last}}.
migration_details_slide.age_unique: Most of the immigrants coming from {{level}} are people ages {{first}}. These represent a {{first_percent}} of the total in {{year_last}}.

migration_education_slide.text_none: There's no data for immigrants from {{level}} to Chile.
migration_education_slide.text:
{{higher_percent}} of the visas granted to immigrants from {{level}} was given to people with a Technical or University degree, while {{highsc_percent}} have an academic degree equivalent to chilean High School. The number of visas granted to immigrants coming from {{level}} with higher education has {{higher_behavior}} {{higher_growth}} between {{year_prev}} and {{year_last}}.

By contrast, {{none_percent}} declare not having any formal education, and {{unknown_percent}} don't disclose their education level.

migration_activity_slide.visa_type: Most of the visas given in {{year_last}} to immigrants coming from {{level}} are for {{first}}, and represent {{first_percent}} of all the visas given to immigrants from {{level}}.
migration_activity_slide.visa_type_0: According to the records, by {{year_last}} there are no records of immigrants from {{level}}.
migration_activity_slide.activity_2: The most common visa granted on {{year_last}} to immigrants from {{level}} is for {{first}} ({{first_percent}}), and {{second}} ({{second_percent}}).
migration_activity_slide.activity_1: The most common visa granted on {{year_last}} to immigrants from {{level}} is for {{first}} ({{first_percent}}).

intltrade_slide.text_none: There's no data on internation trade between Chile and {{level}} in the recent years.
intltrade_slide.text:
During {{year}}, Chile exported a total of US{{total_exports}} FOB to {{level}}, and imported a total of US{{total_imports}} CIF, resulting in a {{behavior}} trade balance of US{{total_balance}}.

The main product Chile imported from {{level}} is {{main_import.name}}. On {{year}}, this represented a {{main_import.percent}} of total imports from {{level}}.

On {{year}}, the main exported product from Chile to {{level}} was {{main_export.name}}. This represented a {{main_export.percent}} of the chilean exports to {{level}}.

intltrade_origin_dest_slide.export_0: There are no records of exports to {{level}} during {{year}}.
intltrade_origin_dest_slide.export_1: The exports from Chile to {{level}} depart mainly from companies with tax residence in the comuna of {{origin.first_municipality}}, in {{origin.first_region}}.
intltrade_origin_dest_slide.export_11: The exports from Chile to {{level}} depart mainly from companies with tax residence in {{origin.first_municipality}}, in {{origin.first_region}}, and {{origin.second_municipality}}, in {{origin.second_region}}.
intltrade_origin_dest_slide.export_2: The exports from Chile to {{level}} depart mainly from companies with tax residence in {{origin.first_region}}, specifically from the comunas of {{origin.first_municipality}} and {{origin.second_municipality}}.
intltrade_origin_dest_slide.export_111: The exports from Chile to {{level}} depart mainly from companies with tax residence in the comuna of {{origin.first_municipality}}, in {{origin.first_region}}. Follow after the comunas of {{origin.second_municipality}}, in {{origin.second_region}}, and {{origin.third_municipality}}, in {{origin.third_region}}.
intltrade_origin_dest_slide.export_12: The exports from Chile to {{level}} depart mainly from companies with tax residence in the comuna of {{origin.first_municipality}}, in {{origin.first_region}}. Follow after the comunas of {{origin.second_municipality}} and {{origin.third_municipality}}, in {{origin.second_region}}.
intltrade_origin_dest_slide.export_21: The exports from Chile to {{level}} depart mainly from companies with tax residence in the comunas of {{origin.first_municipality}} and {{origin.second_municipality}}, in {{origin.first_region}}, and from the comuna of {{origin.third_municipality}}, in {{origin.third_region}}.
intltrade_origin_dest_slide.export_3: The exports from Chile to {{level}} depart mainly from companies with tax residence in {{origin.first_region}}, mainly from the comunas of {{origin.first_municipality}}, {{origin.second_municipality}}, and {{origin.third_municipality}}.
intltrade_origin_dest_slide.import_0: There are no records of imports from {{level}} to Chile during {{year}}.
intltrade_origin_dest_slide.import_1: The main destination of the imports from {{level}} is the comuna of {{destination.first_municipality}}, in {{destination.first_region}}.
intltrade_origin_dest_slide.import_11: The main destination of the imports from {{level}} are the comunas of {{destination.first_municipality}}, in {{destination.first_region}}, and {{destination.second_municipality}}, in {{destination.second_region}}.
intltrade_origin_dest_slide.import_2: The main destination of the imports from {{level}} is {{destination.first_region}}, specifically to the comunas of {{destination.first_municipality}} and {{destination.second_municipality}}.
intltrade_origin_dest_slide.import_111: The main destination of the imports from {{level}} is the comuna of {{destination.first_municipality}}, in {{destination.first_region}}. Follow after, the comunas of {{destination.second_municipality}}, in {{destination.second_region}}, and {{destination.third_municipality}}, in {{destination.third_region}}.
intltrade_origin_dest_slide.import_12: The main destination of the imports from {{level}} is the comuna of {{destination.first_municipality}}, in {{destination.first_region}}. Follow after the comunas of {{destination.second_municipality}} and {{destination.third_municipality}}, in {{destination.second_region}}.
intltrade_origin_dest_slide.import_21: The main destination of the imports from {{level}} are the comunas of {{destination.first_municipality}} and {{destination.second_municipality}}, in {{destination.first_region}}, and the comuna of {{destination.third_municipality}}, in {{destination.third_region}}.
intltrade_origin_dest_slide.import_3: The main destination of the imports from {{level}} is {{destination.first_region}}, mainly to the comunas of {{destination.first_municipality}}, {{destination.second_municipality}}, and {{destination.third_municipality}}.

intltrade_balance_slide.balance: In {{year.last}}, Chile had a {{balance.behavior}} trade balance with {{level}}, which favored {{balance.beneficiary}} in US{{balance.volume_last}}.
intltrade_balance_slide.text_none: There's no data on internation trade between Chile and {{level}} in the recent years.
intltrade_balance_slide.text_imponly:
Between {{year.first}} and {{year.last}}, imports from {{level}} registered an {{import.behavior}} of {{import.growth}}. In nominal terms, this means {{import.direction}} of US{{import.volume_first}} CIF in {{year.first}}, to US{{import.volume_last}} CIF in {{year.last}}.

$t(country_profile.intltrade_balance_slide.balance)
intltrade_balance_slide.text_exponly:
Between {{year.first}} and {{year.last}}, exports to {{level}} have registered an {{export.behavior}} of {{export.growth}}. In nominal terms, this means {{export.direction}} of US{{export.volume_first}} FOB in {{year.first}}, to US{{export.volume_last}} FOB in {{year.last}}.

$t(country_profile.intltrade_balance_slide.balance)
intltrade_balance_slide.text:
Between {{year.first}} and {{year.last}}, exports to {{level}} have registered an {{export.behavior}} of {{export.growth}}. In nominal terms, this means {{export.direction}} of US{{export.volume_first}} FOB in {{year.first}}, to US{{export.volume_last}} FOB in {{year.last}}. In the same period, imports from {{level}} registered {{import.behavior}} of {{import.growth}}, from US{{import.volume_first}} CIF in {{year.first}}, to US{{import.volume_last}} CIF in {{year.last}}.

$t(country_profile.intltrade_balance_slide.balance)

health.access:
En {{year.last}}, {{insurance.total}} personas estaban afiliadas a un sistema de previsión de salud, representando al {{share}} de la población de {{geo.name}}.

Por otra parte, los afiliados a ISAPRES han {{insurance.isapre.increased_or_decreased}} en {{insurance.isapre.rate}} en el periodo {{year.first}}-{{year.last}}
health.death_causes: In the period {{year.first}} - {{year.last}}, death cause with the highest annual growth rate in {{geo.caption}} were {{data.first.caption}} with a {{data.first.rate}}, followed by {{data.second.caption}} with a {{data.second.rate}}.
health.disability: In {{year.last}}, {{data.total}} people at {{geo.caption}} suffered some disabilities type, where {{data.severe.share}} corresponded to a severe disability.
health.healthcare:
En {{year.last}}, se registraron {{healthcare.urgency.total}} atenciones en servicios de urgencias de {{geo.name}}.

Además, el {{healthcare.specialized.share}} de las atenciones médicas que se realizaron fue con especialista, donde el número de atenciones de esto último incrementó a una tasa anual de {{healthcare.specialized.rate}} en el periodo {{year.first}}-{{year.last}}

exports.by_destination: Exports Destination of Companies Based in {{geo.caption}}
exports.by_product: Exported Products by Companies Based in {{geo.caption}}
exports.default: In {{exports.latest_year}} firms located in {{geo.caption}} exported {{exports.trade_volume}}. During the last {{number_of_years}} years, {{geo.caption}} exports have {{exports.increased_or_decreased}} at an annual average rate of {{exports.annualized_rate}}, from {{exports.trade_first_year}} in {{first_year}} to {{exports.trade_last_year}} in {{exports.last_year}}. {{geo.caption}} main export is {{exports.trade_first_product}}, that represents {{exports.trade_first_share}} of {{geo.caption}} total exports, followed by {{exports.trade_second_product}} that represents {{exports.trade_second_share}}.
exports.one: In {{exports.latest_year}} firms located in {{geo.caption}} exported {{exports.trade_volume}}. During the last {{number_of_years}} years, {{geo.caption}} exports have {{exports.increased_or_decreased}} at an annual average rate of {{exports.annualized_rate}}, from {{exports.trade_first_year}} in {{first_year}} to {{exports.trade_last_year}} in {{exports.last_year}}. {{geo.caption}} only export is {{exports.trade_first_product}}.
exports.no_data: There is no export data about firms located in {{geo.caption}}.

imports.by_origin: Imports Origin of Companies Based in {{geo.caption}}
imports.by_product: Imported Products by Companies Based in {{geo.caption}}
imports.default: In {{imports.latest_year}} firms located in {{geo.caption}} imported {{imports.trade_volume}}. During the last {{number_of_years}} years, {{geo.caption}} imports have {{imports.increased_or_decreased}} at an annual average rate of {{imports.annualized_rate}}, from {{imports.trade_first_year}} in {{first_year}} to {{imports.trade_last_year}} in {{imports.last_year}}. {{geo.caption}} main import is {{imports.trade_first_product}}, that represents {{imports.trade_first_share}} of {{geo.caption}} total imports, followed by {{imports.trade_second_product}} that represents {{imports.trade_second_share}}.
imports.one: In {{imports.latest_year}} firms located in {{geo.caption}} imported {{imports.trade_volume}}. During the last {{number_of_years}} years, {{geo.caption}} imports have {{imports.increased_or_decreased}} at an annual average rate of {{imports.annualized_rate}}, from {{imports.trade_first_year}} in {{first_year}} to {{imports.trade_last_year}} in {{imports.last_year}}. {{geo.caption}} only import is {{imports.trade_first_product}}.
imports.no_data: There is no import data about firms located in {{geo.caption}}.

economy.rca: Revealed Comparative Advantage (RCA) measures specialization level for a location in an industry or product. In case a locality has RCA greater than one at an economic activity, the referred activity has greater presence on that location with respect to an average location.
economy.product_space:
Comunas, regions and countries have a greater probability of starting related economic activities with respect to those activities they already perform. The product space connects products that tend to be exported by the same countries.

Higher presence products in {{geo.caption}} are highlighted in colours. By clicking on networks you can see the most related products and industries (and with higher development probability) related to those already present in {{geo.caption}}.
economy.industry_space:
Comunas, regions and countries have a greater probability of starting related economic activities with respect to those activities they already perform. The industry space connects industries that tend to exist by the same countries.

Higher presence industries in {{geo.caption}} are highlighted in colours. By clicking on networks you can see the most related products and industries (and with higher development probability) related to those already present in {{geo.caption}}.
economy.industry:

definitions.efectiveness: Educational result obtained by the establishment in relation with the population served.
definitions.overcoming: Diferenciales de logro educativo obtenidos en el tiempo por el establecimiento educacional.
definitions.initiative: Capacidad del establecimiento para incorporar innovaciones educativas y comprometer el apoyo de agentes externos en su quehacer pedagógico.
definitions.integration: Integración y participación de profesores y profesoras, padres y apoderados en el desarrollo del proyecto educativo del establecimiento.
definitions.improvement: Mejoramiento de las condiciones de trabajo y adecuado funcionamiento del establecimiento.
definitions.fairness: Igualdad de oportunidades, que corresponde a la accesibilidad y permanencia de la población escolar en el establecimiento educacional y la integración de grupos con dificultades de aprendizaje.

slides.text: The Map is an interactive tool...
...that groups information derived from the datachile.io website, through Topics and Indicators...
...allowing the user to cross-reference data, and painting that info on the map.
Also, the Map counts with a “CART” tool: you can select specific data groups and save them, to download them later.
The data is organized so you can choose to group years in rows or columns. With just a click, you can download your collection to a CSV file, ready to use.

no_info: {{no}} has not data for this topic. You can see information at regional level in {{yes}}'s profile.

home.subtitle: The most comprehensive effort to integrate and visualize Chile’s Public Data

what.title: What is DataChile?
what.text1: It offers an x-ray of the most important topics for the development of the country.
what.text2: It helps to know trends and needs for the design and implementation of public policies, civil society programs, business opportunities and marketing strategies of the private sector.
what.text3: Collaborate in making decisions in public and private sector.

diff.title: Why is DataChile different from other open data projects?
diff.text1: Integrates information from more than 15 different sources belonging to more than 10 government agencies.
diff.text3: Thinks the data as stories and not as files.

sources.title: DataChile integrates data from all these sources

form.data: Did not find what you were looking for? Suggest data to add
form.error: Did you find an error? Report it

intro.text1: DataChile uses Mondrian-REST, which is a server side software component that allows creation of HTTP APIs for accessing a database by specifying the logical structure of the information.
intro.text2: To use the DataChile API, it is necessary to know some concepts that will facilitate its use, which we will be explain then.

syntax.text1: The single entry point for aggregation operations in Mondrian-REST is /aggregate, which accepts the described parameters then.
syntax.text2: For an particular cube, get the members belonging to a certain level in a dimension.

definitions.cube: A cube is a collection of dimensions and measures.
definitions.cube2: In DataChile, each dataset is grouped in a cube. The design of the API query language is centered around 3 operations: Drilldown, Cut and Measure. To exemplify the concepts, exports dataset - which represents Chile's exports - will be used as a reference.
definitions.drilldown: A drilldown allows to move from one level of detail to the next. The drilldown structure for queries in the cube is [Dimension].[Hierarchy].[Level]
definitions.member: A member is a point within a dimension determined by a particular set of attribute values. The gender hierarchy has the two members 'Male' and 'Female'. 'Concepcion', 'Bio-Bio' and 'Chile' are all members of the geography hierarchy.
definitions.hierarchy: A hierarchy is a set of members organized into a structure for convenient analysis. For example, the geography hierarchy consists of the city, region, and country. The hierarchy allows you to form intermediate sub-totals: the sub-total for a region is the sum of the sub-totals of all of the cities in that region.
definitions.level: A level is a collection of members which have the same distance from the root of the hierarchy.
definitions.dimension: A dimension is a collection of hierarchies which discriminate on the same fact table attribute (say, the day that a sale occurred).
definitions.measure: Scalar variable associated with a particular fact in the cube data.
definitions.cut: Allows the user to specify a filter, which effectively restricts the cube in which the aggregations are performed. Cutting the exports cube along the [Region] .[8] member in the Geography dimension, will only consider cells by Bio-Bio. Multiple cuts can be specified in a single query.
definitions.nonempty: Returns the set of tuples that are not empty from a specified set, based on the cross product of the specified set with a second set.
definitions.distinct: Evaluates a specified set, removes duplicate tuples from the set, and returns the resulting set.

descriptions.drilldown[]: For create a drilldown, you must considerate: Dimension, Hierarchy, Level. [Dimension].[Hierarchy].[Level]
descriptions.cut[]: You must concatenate drilldown where you need to make the cut with specific Level ID member. [Dimension].[Hierarchy].[Level].&[member_id]1
descriptions.parents: If depth level is higher than 1, get ID and name from parent levels.
descriptions.sparse: Check if a certain tuple is NOT in the aggregation, this is not included in the resulting table.

pagenote.text1: 1. If the query is made directly in URL, it must be replaced & by %26 to avoid problems of cutting parsing.

client-python.text1: To encourage the use of the DataChile API, we have enabled in Python a pip module that allows to interact with the cubes.
client-python.text2: For to install, you can use pip: pip install datachile

complex.text1: These criteria can be combined to define robust queries. Here are a few examples.
complex.text2: Select values of Valparaiso (ID 5) and Coquimbo (ID 4) regions.
complex.text3: For generate cuts for more than an ID, every cut must be separately by , within {}.
complex.text4: Get imports from every county in Chile between 2013 and 2015.

examples.text1: The next examples show how are builded the queries, using drilldowns, cuts and measures. Here you can see URL aspect and JSON returned related with the question: What number of people are in every health insurance at Concepcion?

datasets.text1: These data are gotten since https://chilecube.datachile.io/cubes
